headline.print_headline: A City Ban Changes the Christmas Scene
headline.seo: Federal Judge Denies Request to Block Nativity Ban
headline.main: A City Ban Changes the Christmas Scene

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Monday denied a request from a nonprofit group to temporarily block a ban on unattended displays in Santa Monica, Calif....
docs.abstract: Federal judge in Los Angeles denies request from nonprofit group Santa Monica Nativity Scenes Committee to temporarily block city's ban on unattended displays in Palisades Park; measure was passed in 2011 by City Council on heels of dispute over atheist displays outnumbering traditional Christian scenes; series of 14 Nativity scenes have been a mainstay in park since 1950s.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday denied a request from a nonprofit group to temporarily block a ban on unattended displays in Santa Monica, Calif.

headline.print_headline: After Obama, Christie Wants A G.O.P. Hug
headline.seo: Christie’s Post-Hurricane Embrace of Obama Outrages Many in G.O.P.
headline.main: After Obama, Christie Wants a G.O.P. Hug

docs.snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, who praised the president just before Election Day, is trying to tame the fury of fellow Republicans who feel he betrayed Mitt Romney....
docs.abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, who praised Pres Obama for his response to Hurricane Sandy just before Election Day, is trying to tame fury of fellow Republicans who feel that he betrayed Mitt Romney; tensions between Christie and other party members appear to linger even as he takes steps to apologize and explain.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, who praised the president just before Election Day, is trying to tame the fury of fellow Republicans who feel he betrayed Mitt Romney.

headline.print_headline: Powerful Backer for China’s New Manhattan
headline.seo: Financial District Project in China Has Local Support
headline.main: Powerful Backer for China’s New Manhattan

docs.snippet: The Yujiapu financial district, seen as a symbol of the nation’s growing economy, was financed by state-owned banks, but is also closely associated with a little-known local politician....

keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Yujiapu financial district in Tianjin, nicknamed China's new Manhattan and symbol of nation's growing economy, is overseen by Zhang Gaoli, local politician who has joined new Politburo Standing Committee; Zhang has emerged as man expected to handle day-to-day management of Chinese economy; policies he has pursued in Tianjin and in managing development of Yujiapu hint that he may favor progressive social policies.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yujiapu financial district, seen as a symbol of the nation’s growing economy, was financed by state-owned banks, but is also closely associated with a little-known local politician.

headline.seo: John Gagliardi, College Football’s Winningest Coach, Retires

docs.snippet: At 86, John Gagliardi is stepping down after 64 seasons as a college football coach, 60 of them at St. John’s University in Collegeville, Minn....
docs.abstract: St John's football coach John Gagliardi announces that he is retiring after 60 seasons; Gagliardi has won more games, 489, and coached more seasons, 64, than anyone in history of college football.
docs.lead_paragraph: At 86, John Gagliardi is stepping down after 64 seasons as a college football coach, 60 of them at St. John’s University in Collegeville, Minn.

headline.seo: Day Laborers Offer Help After Hurricane Sandy

docs.snippet: Warmth and gratitude greeted volunteers who did their part to help clean up in Coney Island....
docs.abstract: Editorial applauds warmth and gratitude with which day Hispanic day laborers were greeted by state and city officials and residents of Coney Island due to their volunteer work helping area recover from Hurricane Sandy; highlights sense of community, which seemed to suggest that in wake of disaster, volunteers' immigration status did not matter.
docs.lead_paragraph: Warmth and gratitude greeted volunteers who did their part to help clean up in Coney Island.

headline.print_headline: Selig Approves Miami-Toronto Deal, Saying Judgment Involved Is ‘Plausible’
headline.seo: Bud Selig Approves Marlins and Blue Jays Trade
headline.main: Selig Approves Miami-Toronto Deal, Saying Judgment Involved Is ‘Plausible’

docs.snippet: Major League Baseball approved a trade in which Miami sent high-priced players — Jose Reyes, Josh Johnson and Mark Buehrle — to Toronto for promising young players....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; MLB commissioner Bud Selig formally approves 12-player trade that sends five Miami Marlins veterans to Toronto Blue Jays; other baseball news noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball approved a trade in which Miami sent high-priced players — Jose Reyes, Josh Johnson and Mark Buehrle — to Toronto for promising young players.

headline.print_headline: Tax Talks Raise Bar for Richest
headline.main: Tax Talks Raise Bar for Richest Americans

docs.snippet: The changes being discussed by the president and Congressional Republicans would take the biggest bite from the highest earners and a smaller share from those earning less than $500,000....
docs.abstract: Changes in tax rates being discussed by Pres Obama and Congressional Republicans include taking most from highest earners and smaller share from those earning less than $500,000 yearly; negotiations surrounding deficit reduction appear to moving closer to a true 'millionaires' tax,' in which increases would be heavily weighted toward the wealthiest Americans.
docs.lead_paragraph: The changes being discussed by the president and Congressional Republicans would take the biggest bite from the highest earners and a smaller share from those earning less than $500,000.

headline.print_headline: American Carriers Are Left Behind In Cargo Program
headline.main: American Carriers Are Left Behind in Cargo Program

docs.snippet: A program that subsidizes the shipment of United States military cargo was started as a way to boost American shipping, but it is dominated by overseas shipping giants....

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Program that subsidizes shipment of United States military cargo was started as way to boost American shipping, but it is dominated by overseas shipping giants; financing for  $2 billion operation is up for renewal in Congress, sparking debate about its future, and volatile issue of foreign ownership in American industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: A program that subsidizes the shipment of United States military cargo was started as a way to boost American shipping, but it is dominated by overseas shipping giants.

docs.snippet: After relieving Erik Soler of his general manager duties, the Red Bulls kept up their shake-up by waiving 10 players, including veteran midfielders Jan Gunnar Solli and Teemu Tainio....
docs.abstract: New York Red Bulls continue their roster shake-up by waiving 10 players.
docs.lead_paragraph: After relieving Erik Soler of his general manager duties, the Red Bulls kept up their shake-up by waiving 10 players, including veteran midfielders Jan Gunnar Solli and Teemu Tainio.

docs.snippet: An unorthodox crop of  center-right free-thinkers defy    caricatures of the G.O.P....
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column analyzes state of Republican Party and conservative movement in wake of presidential election; observes that there is unorthodox crop of center-right intellectuals that refutes prominent caricatures of Republicans.
docs.lead_paragraph: An unorthodox crop of  center-right free-thinkers defy    caricatures of the G.O.P.
